general_advisory: It is recommended to apply pre-emergence herbicides in paddy fields, manage Bacterial Leaf Blight in paddy, control stem and root borer in cashew, sow Cowpea, Cluster bean, Pumpkin, Cucumber, and Watermelon in February-March, transplant vegetables in the afternoon to avoid high temperature, harvest mustard and potato crops at the right time, manage Tobacco Caterpillar pest, and follow specific management practices for different crops mentioned in the advisory.

advisory: Apply 35 kg Urea per acre at 3 weeks after transplanting for high yielding paddy varieties
Harvest the mustard crop as soon as the pods turn yellowish-brown to avoid shattering
To manage Tobacco Caterpillar pest in Groundnut, Blackgram, Greengram proper surveillance should be done to collect and destroy egg mass and caterpillar of the pest
To manage stem borer in cashew remove minimum width of the bark retaining at least 50% of the bark circumference
Harvest the potato crop which are at 75-85 days after planting and when majority of the leaves turn yellowish brown
To control aphids during primary stage of pest infestation spray Neem Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) @ 600 ml/acre
To control aphids during primary stage of pest infestation spray Neem Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) @ 600 ml/acre
To manage Tobacco Caterpillar pest proper surveillance should be done and Pheromone traps should be set up
To manage little leaf in brinjal remove infected plants and spray recommended pesticides
To manage leaf webber and head borer pests, regular monitoring of pest infestation should be carried out and specific pesticides should be applied
